reporting_cycle: Secretary-General and Panel of Experts reports: midterm update by 15 June 2023, final report by 15 October 2023; review of mandate by 15 November 2023
summary:
The Security Council:

Recalling previous resolutions on Yemen, reaffirms its commitment to Yemen's unity, sovereignty, and territorial integrity. 

Determining the situation in Yemen remains a threat to international peace and security, 

Acting under Chapter VII, 

1. Renews until 15 November 2023 measures imposed by paragraphs 11 and 15 of resolution 2140 (2014), reaffirming provisions of paragraphs 12, 13, 14, and 16 of resolution 2140 (2014) and paragraphs 14 to 17 of resolution 2216 (2015).

2. Extends the Panel of Experts' mandate until 15 December 2023, and intends to review and take action on its further extension by 15 November 2023. 

3. Requests the Panel to provide a midterm update to the Committee by 15 June 2023 and a final report to the Security Council by 15 October 2023.

4. Remains seized of the matter.
